The strategic and ethical use of media in developing and implementing effective public health communications is a focus of the course. The targeting of health communication campaigns to populations for the purpose of influencing behaviors and health policy will be examined.

PUBH.6890.name: PUBH.6890 Advanced Regression Modeling (Formerly 19.689)
PUBH.6890.description: This course will introduce linear, generalized linear and time-to-event regression models that are commonly used in epidemiologic research, community needs assessment and public health program/policy evaluations. Topics include regression models for continuous, binary, ordinal, multinomial, count, time-to-event, and longitudinal data.
PUBH.6890.requirements-text: PUBH.5750 Intro to Epidemiology, or PUBH.5770 Biostats for Health Data, or NURS.7070 Epidemiology of Health Promotion, or permission of instructor.

PUBH.6900.name: PUBH.6900 Critical Review Health Regulations (Formerly 19.690)
PUBH.6900.description: Course designed to explore the practical applications of epidemiologic methods to the setting of actual standards. Students gain experience in distinguishing minor from major design and analysis flaws. Course is presented as a seminar with four case studies and problem analysis.

PUBH.6910.name: PUBH.6910 Advanced Program Evaluation
PUBH.6910.description: The focus of this course is the development of skills needed to plan, conduct, and critique evaluations. Students will learn the major principles and methods associated with systematic evaluation of public health initiatives.

PUBH.6950.name: PUBH.6950 Chemical Process/Sustainability (Formerly 19.695)
PUBH.6950.description: This course surveys the basis of chemical engineering process design and fundamentals of unit operations. The student will be able to understand the basics of chemical engineering design methods for the purpose of enhancing sustainability of chemical production processes.

PUBH.7020.name: PUBH.7020 Independent Study: Industrial Hygiene (Formerly 19.702)
PUBH.7020.description: Advanced topics in industrial hygiene, exposure assessment or exposure control not offered in the regular curriculum. Topics may vary from year to year.

PUBH.7040.name: PUBH.7040 Independent Study: Ergonomics (Formerly 19.704)
PUBH.7040.description: Advanced topics in biomechanics, work physiology, occupational safety or human factors not covered in the regular curriculum. Content may vary from year to year.

PUBH.7080.name: PUBH.7080 Independent Study: Epidemiology (Formerly 19.708)
PUBH.7080.description: Advanced topics in occupational epidemiology, design and confounding, exposure-response modeling, or surveillance not covered in the regular curriculum. Content may vary from year to year.

PUBH.7090.name: PUBH.7090 Independent Studies: Occupational Epidemiology (Formerly 19.709)
PUBH.7090.description: Advanced topics in occupational epidemiology, design and confounding, exposure-response modeling, or surveillance not covered in the regular curriculum. Content may vary from year to year.

PUBH.7110.name: PUBH.7110 Independent Study: Industrial Hygiene (Formerly 19.711)
PUBH.7110.description: Advanced topics in industrial hygiene, exposure assessment or exposure control not offered in the regular curriculum. Topics may vary from year to year.

PUBH.7120.name: PUBH.7120 Independent Study: Industrial Hygiene (Formerly 19.712)
PUBH.7120.description: Advanced topics in industrial hygiene, exposure assessment or exposure control not offered in the regular curriculum. Topics may vary from year to year.

PUBH.7130.name: PUBH.7130 Independent Study: Ergonomics (Formerly 19.713)
PUBH.7130.description: Advanced topics in biomechanics, work physiology, occupational safety or human factors not covered in the regular curriculum. Content may vary from year to year.

PUBH.7150.name: PUBH.7150 Independent Study: Work Environment Policy (Formerly 19.715)
PUBH.7150.description: Advanced topics in work environment policy, risk perception, risk communication and management, regulatory affairs or labor-management programs not covered in the regular curriculum. Content may vary from year to year.

PUBH.7170.name: PUBH.7170 Independent Study: Epidemiology (Formerly 19.717)
PUBH.7170.description: Advanced topics in occupational epidemiology, design and confounding, exposure-response modeling, or surveillance not covered in the regular curriculum. Content may vary from year to year.

PUBH.7190.name: PUBH.7190 Independent Study: Clean Production (Formerly 19.719)
PUBH.7190.description: Advanced topics in clean production, pollution prevention, and environmental protection efforts. Not offered in the regular curriculum. Topics may vary from year to year.

PUBH.7210.name: PUBH.7210 Selected Topics : Industrial  Hygiene (Formerly 19.721)
PUBH.7210.description: There is currently no description available for this course.

PUBH.7230.name: PUBH.7230 Selected Topics: Ergonomics (Formerly 19.723)
PUBH.7230.description: There is currently no description available for this course.

PUBH.7250.name: PUBH.7250 Epidemiologic Theory (Formerly 19.725)
PUBH.7250.description: An advanced seminar in epidemiologic theory.  The goal of the course is to develop each student's own theoretical perspective on the field to ground practical problems of study design and analysis.   Students read a major text in modern chronic disease epidemiology as well as relevant papers, and discuss and evaluate the perspectives of different authors.  Topics include: causality, study designs, measures of disease frequency, measures of association, statistical inference, biases, and confounding.

PUBH.7270.name: PUBH.7270 Sel Top: Epidemiology (Formerly 19.727)
PUBH.7270.description: There is currently no description available for this course.

PUBH.7280.name: PUBH.7280 Sel Top: Work Env Policy (Formerly 19.728)
PUBH.7280.description: There is currently no description available for this course.

PUBH.7290.name: PUBH.7290 Selected Topics : Clean Production (Formerly 19.729)
PUBH.7290.description: There is currently no description available for this course.

PUBH.7330.name: PUBH.7330 Capstone Project (Formerly 32.733)
PUBH.7330.description: Near the end of one's Master's Degree program, students register for Capstone Project and complete a real world case study report and presentation. The Capstone Project applies concepts and skills learned in the program. It involves research and development, and culminates in a substantial business-type report. 3 credits, Requires Instructor Permission.

PUBH.7331.name: PUBH.7331 Graduate Project (Formerly 19.733)
PUBH.7331.description: Advanced research project required of all master's degree candidates in the ergonomics, industrial hygiene, occupational epidemiology and work environment policy concentrations.

PUBH.7350.name: PUBH.7350 Independent Study:  Policy (Formerly 19.735)

PUBH.7390.name: PUBH.7390 Graduate Project - Work Environment (Formerly 19.739)
PUBH.7390.description: Advanced research project required of all master's degree candidates in the ergonomics, industrial hygiene, occupational epidemiology and work environment policy concentrations.

PUBH.7430.name: PUBH.7430 Master's Thesis Research (Formerly 19.743)

PUBH.7610.name: PUBH.7610 1 - Credit Continued Graduate Research (Formerly 19.761)
PUBH.7610.description: 1-Credit Continued Graduate Research course is for students with less than one year to defend or complete program.  Part of reduce course load program for international students.

PUBH.7630.name: PUBH.7630 Continued Graduate  Research (Formerly 19.763)

PUBH.7700.name: PUBH.7700 Directed  Readings: Epidemiology  Biostatistics (Formerly 19.770

PUBH.7750.name: PUBH.7750 Capstone/Thesis Review (Formerly 32.775)
PUBH.7750.description: There is currently no description available for this course.

PUBH.7760.name: PUBH.7760 Curricular Practical Training (CPT) (Formerly 32.776)
PUBH.7760.description: An internship, practicum or other type of employment that is either required by the students academic program or an experience for which a student receives academic credit. To be eligible the student must be in legal F-1 status and have been enrolled full-time for one academic year. CPT work experience must be in the students field of study and contain a curricular component. "Variable credit course, student chooses appropriate amount of credits when registering."

PUBH.9990.name: PUBH.9990 Intercampus Graduate Researdh (Formerly 19.999)
PUBH.9990.description: This course will allow doctorate students to remain active while they are taking courses/research at the other UMASS campuses.
